column1: Ocosingo is a city and its surrounding municipality (municipio) of the same name in the Mexican state of Chiapas.
The municipality borders the Usumacinta River along a portion where the river forms the international border with Guatemala.

column2: the municipality had a total population of 198

column1: Ocosingo rose to national prominence during the Zapatista uprising of 1994. It was occupied by the EZLN along with several other towns in Chiapas (including San Cristóbal). The EZLN retreated from most towns before the arrival of the Mexican army but not so in Ocosingo. Thus
column2: the town saw several days of intense fighting
